title: New food street inaugurated at IIUI
content:
ISLAMABAD, Sep 14 (APP):The newly established food street for the students of the university at the male campus was inaugurated on Thursday by Dr. Hathal Homoud Alotaibi, President, International Islamic University (IIU).
The guest of honour Capt. (Retd.) Anwar ul Haq, Chief Commissioner / Chairman CDA/ was also accompanied by the President.
The food street has been established to provide a variety of food to students such as fast food, traditional dishes and beverages with the best dining facilities in light of the vision of IIUI President to facilitate the students on top priority.
After the inauguration, the IIUI President and the guest of honour Capt. (Retd.) Anwar ul Haq visited all the food chains, stalls and cabins dedicated to different food items.
The IIUI President also met with the students and inquired about the quality of food and provision of the services. “Your facilitation is our top priority,” said Dr. Hathal while directing that the students must not face any problems.
He said the goal of the IIUI administration is to provide an ideal milieu to the students across the campus, and after students facilitation centre, now this food street is part of that mission.
He said more such facilities will be included in the near future and told that more such Cafes will be inaugurated in this month.
Capt. (Retd.) Anwar ul Haq, appreciated the initiative adding that it is encouraging to see that university leadership is keen to facilitate the students. He also praised the standards and ambience of the food street.
Both the guest was given a briefing about the new set-up, quality food provision, hygiene-related measures, the ambiance of the location, proper sitting for the students and a dedicated dining area for the teachers.
They were apprised that the locations have been designed in a food street pattern where students without any delay will have all the food items including fast food, BBQ, traditional food, salads and other cuisines.
The university will soon inaugurate more including the one in the female campus near Maryam block and the Cafeteria near the male hostel no 4.
Later, Capt. (Retd.) Anwar ul Haq, Chairman CDA/ Chief Commissioner also met with IIUI President at his office where issues of mutual interest and the role of the university in society building were discussed.
The IIUI President apprised the Chairman CDA about the vision of the university and its newly established strategic plan.
Capt. (Retd.) Anwar ul Haq hailed the efforts of IIUI President for the betterment of university and praised his student-centric approach.
He said the IIUI is playing a vital role in nurturing the young minds of Muslim world according to contemporary needs and Islamic values.
